intro: Meliosma reticulata, commonly known as the net-veined meliosma, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other economically important trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with a distinctive reticulate venation pattern. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically greenish-yellow and arranged in panicles. The fruit is a drupe, containing a single seed enclosed in a fleshy pulp.
